ygData.subject: Re: [neat] Using NEAT and CPPN for material selection.

Thanks for your interest in our work Ian. I saw that Nick Cheney responded =
to an email you sent us directly and offered suggestions. Good luck with yo=
ur project and please post the results here. I=92m sure people on this list=
 will find them interesting. 


Best regards,
Jeff Clune

Assistant Profess=
or
Computer Science
University of Wyoming
jeffclune@...
jeffclune.com
=

On Dec 13, 2013, at 5:00 AM, Ian Qvist <qvistian@...> wrote:

> Hi e=
veryone,
> 
> I'm trying to replicate the behavior of the paper 'Unshacklin=
g
> Evolution: Evolving Soft Robots with Multiple Materials and a Powerful
=
> Generative Encoding' by Nick Cheney, Robert MacCurdy, Jeff Clune and
> Ho=
d Lipson.
> 
> The difference is that instead of using soft bodies, I'm usi=
ng soft
> distance joints, and instead of 3D, I'm using 2D.
> 
> I have a s=
imulation up and running using a 10x10 2D grid of
> interconnected bodies, =
and the material type of each body determines
> the behavior of each connec=
tion to the body. My problem is that I
> would like the 10x10 grid to have =
material types selected by an ANN
> using NEAT and CPPN such that I get sym=
metry and repetitions in the
> material selection.
> 
> I'm pretty much com=
pletely new to this field, so I need an expert that
> can help me with the =
implementation (I'm currently using SharpNEAT in C#).
> 
> Anyone willing t=
o help me out? I can pay for the consultation.
> 
> -- 
> Best Regards,
> I=
an Qvist
> 


--Apple-Mail=_01316812-CE70-44D1-AE9B-6433B79F7F79
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/html;
	charset=windows-1252
